abstract: Sam Bradford's rookie season in St. Louis was noteworthy for just one thing: he threw the ball a lot. His second season isn't going any better.
snippet: Sam Bradford's rookie season in St. Louis was noteworthy for just one thing: he threw the ball a lot. His second season isn't going any better.
lead_paragraph: Chase Stuart, who contributes to the Fifth Down, took some criticism from Rams fans in August for writing on Pro-Football-Reference.com that Sam Bradford's rookie season in 2010 was overrated. Stuart's point was that football pundits were overrating Bradford -- he was being called a surefire star -- not that Bradford was a failure.
